standard.description: These tests help support Accessibility standards. They are not substitutes for screen reader tests and other manual tests.

test.test_name: Some fields benefit from an autocomplete attribute
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when (lower(trim(html_form_element_attributes)) not like '%autocomplete%'
                           or trim(html_form_element_attributes) is null) 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id,
                   application_name, 
                   page_id, 
                   page_name,
                   region, 
                   item_name,
                   html_form_element_attributes,
                   label,
                   workspace,
                   last_updated_by,
                   last_updated_on,
                   build_option,
                   item_help_text,
                   item_id,
                   display_as,
                   display_as_code
             from apex_application_page_items
             where display_as_code not in ('NATIVE_HIDDEN','NATIVE_CHECKBOX','NATIVE_SINGLE_CHECKBOX', 'NATIVE_RADIOGROUP','NATIVE_YES_NO')
						 and lower(item_name) not like '%api%'
						 and lower(item_name) not like '%addressed%'
             and (
                    (lower(label) like '%name%' and (lower(label) like '%first%' or lower(label) like '%last%' or lower(label) like '%family%'))
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%address%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%phone number%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%mail%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%birthday%' or lower(label) like '%bday%')
                 )
 )
select aapi.pass_yn,
       aapi.workspace workspace,
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('`%3`/`%5` Page Item `%0`/`%4` (app %1, page %2) could benefit from an autocomplete attribute', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.display_as,
        p4 => aapi.label,
        p5 => aapi.display_as_code) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing autocomplete', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       aapi.item_help_text,
       aapi.display_as,
       aapi.display_as_code,
       aapi.label,
       esa.type_code
from aapi
inner join v_svt_stds_applications esa on aapi.application_id = esa.apex_app_id
																			 and esa.type_code in ('HUMANX')
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
If you are soliciting routine information like name, address, contact info, etc - you can prompt the browser to supply the stored information for the user. This can be big help to all users and users with accessibility-needs especially.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.3.5(AA) : Identify Input Purpose:
    
    The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when:
    
    The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section; and  
    The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying the expected meaning for form input data.
test.fix: Add the appropriate [autocomplete attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete). For example, add `autocomplete="email"`Â  to the `Custom Attributes` field
